properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Town Of Luseland
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Town of Luseland. This advisory is for the entire Town of Luseland and for any individuals who may access water from the Luseland water system. This advisory is in effect until noon on May 23, 2019.
Expires: 2019-05-23T12:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Luseland, 2019-05-17T09:32:06-06:00, 8BF24340-6C42-5C82-B76E-62651D6162EC
Area: Town of Luseland
properties.Author: SK Luseland

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain will begin tonight and will continue until late Monday. Thunderstorms are likely to accompany the rain on Sunday. Localized rainfall amounts of 20 to 40 mm are possible in areas that receive thunderstorms. Localized flooding is possible. For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources and Forestry District Office. This rain is associated with a slow moving warm front moving over the region. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-19T03:30:07-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-18T19:31:07-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1761537533.2019
Area: Petawawa - Pembroke - Cobden, Barry's Bay - Killaloe, Renfrew - Arnprior - Calabogie
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Cancelled - Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued By The City Of Swift Current Along With The Water Security Agency
properties.Summary:
Description: Cancelled the Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory for the City of Swift Current along with the Water Security Agency. The test results came back clear, and the water is now safe to drink again.
Expires: 2019-05-18T15:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre, 2019-05-18T14:38:43-06:00, F5AE0661-CA63-958B-D5CA-E3C5725A86DC
Area: City of Swift Current
properties.Author: SK Provincial Emergency Communications Centre

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A ridge of high pressure over the northern Prairies continues to circulate cool northeasterly winds across much of the Prairies. Temperatures are expected to drop to near or below the freezing mark tonight especially over western Manitoba. Extreme southern areas of the province will have a bit more cloud and slightly stronger winds that will aid in keeping temperatures from falling below freezing. Frost advisories are issued from the Saturday of the Victoria Day weekend to September 30 when required. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-19T11:59:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-18T20:00:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0946958215.2019
Area: The Pas Cormorant Westray and Wanless, North and South Moose Lake incl. Moose Lake Res.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Frost Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Frost may damage some crops in frost-prone areas. Temperatures are expected to fall to near zero tonight and early Sunday morning. ### Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NBStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-19T10:51:15-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-18T18:52:15-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0069302452.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain expected on Sunday and Monday. A large weather system will move over Western Quebec overnight Saturday to Sunday. Light rain will begin Sunday morning and intensify during the day. Rainfall amounts between 20 and 40 millimetres are expected through Monday evening. The rain, possibly heavy, could contribute to rising water levels. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-05-19T03:47:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-05-18T19:48:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1679849556.2019

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms and rain are expectes late in the day on Sunday. A large weather system will begin to spread over Southern Quebec on Sunday morning. Strong thunderstorms could develop late in the day and give significant rainfall amounts locally. The rain, possibly heavy, could contribute to rising water levels. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
